bibl.title: Letter from C.C. Williamson to Henry Rose Carter, January 28, 1924

div1.p: Williamson thanks Carter for his suggestions in regards to an article entitled "The Use of Fish for the Control of Mosquitoes."

div1.head: Letter from C.C. Williamson to Henry Rose Carter, January 28, 1924
div1.opener:
GEORGE E. VINCENT, PRESIDENT
EDWIN R. EMBREE, SECRETARY
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES
L. G. MYERS, TREASURER
ROBERT H. KIRK, COMPTROLLER
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “ROCKFOUND”
Fish
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
F. F. RUSSELL, M. D., GENERAL DIRECTOR
CHINA MEDICAL BOARD
ROGER S. GREENE, DIRECTOR
DIVISION OF MEDICAL EDUCATION
RICHARD M. PEARCE, M. D., DIRECTOR
INFORMATION SERVICE
C. C. WILLIAMSON, Chief
January 28, 1924
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
I fear I have not acknowledged your letter of January
6 and your numerous very valuable suggestions in regard to the
article we are proposing to publish on “The Use of Fish for the
Control of Mosquitoes”. We have found your notes and suggestions
of the utmost value and we are incorporating them, together with
the suggestions we have received from other sources, in the final
proof which we hope soon to publish. We will, of course, send
you copies of the finished pamphlet.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, C. C. Williamson Dr. H. R. Carter,
2121 California Street, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
CCW:RCC
